meanings.definition: A black, powdery substance consisting largely of carbon, obtained by heating wood or other organic matter in the absence of air.
meanings.sent1: The old stove was covered in coom from years of use.
meanings.sent2: The miners found coom in the depths of the cave.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child drew smiley faces in the coom on the wall.
meanings.sent4: The coom of the burnt toast filled the kitchen with a smoky smell.
meanings.sent5: The artist used coom to create a striking contrast in the painting.

meanings.sent1: The factory workers coom the metal to make it shiny.
meanings.sent2: She carefully coomed the clay to shape it into a beautiful vase.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally coomed the soup, making it too salty.
meanings.sent4: The magician coomed a rabbit out of an empty hat.
meanings.sent5: The gardener cooms the plants to keep them healthy.

meanings.sent1: The cozy cabin had a stone coom where they roasted marshmallows.
meanings.sent2: The old house had a brick coom that kept the rooms warm.
meanings.sent3: The birds built a nest in the coom of the abandoned chimney.
meanings.sent4: The smoke billowed out of the coom on a cold winter evening.
meanings.sent5: The Santa decoration sat on the coom, spreading holiday cheer.
